title: EBay Tries to Buy Its Way Out of Trouble
summary: The e-retailer's results show activist's recommendations have merit. EBay 's mixed fourth-quarter results reported on Tuesday show it could use an activist's helping hand.

title: Uber Wants You to Catch the Bus or Train-if They Can Drive You There
summary: Ride-sharing giant is forging links with public-transit systems, seeking to move from being primarily a taxi-like service. Uber Technologies Inc., fresh from disrupting the taxi industry and leaping into food delivery, is devising a new business strategy ahead of its anticipated public offering: ferrying passengers to and from mass-transit systems.

title: 'Empire' Star Jussie Smollett Attacked in Possible Hate Crime
summary: Actor is cooperating with investigators, police say. CHICAGO-A star of the hit TV series "Empire," Jussie Smollett, was attacked early Tuesday morning in Chicago by two men who allegedly yelled racist and antigay slurs, then wrapped a rope around his neck, according to the Chicago Police Department.

title: Trading of PdVSA Bonds Comes to a Halt
summary: Investors, banks seek to comply with new U.S. sanctions on Venezuela's state-owned oil company. Investors and banks have stopped trading bonds issued by Venezuela's state-owned oil company as they move to comply with new sanctions imposed by the Trump administration on the energy firm.

title: Former RBA Board Member Edwards Expects Rates to Rise
summary: Resume Subscription. SYDNEY-The next move in Australian interest rates is likely to be up, and strong rates of economic growth and higher inflation remain plausible in 2019, said John Edwards, economist and former member of the policy-setting board of the Reserve Bank of Australia.

title: Clover Health Doubles Total Funding With $500 Million Round
summary: Greenoaks Capital leads deal backing insurance startup, part of a growing cohort of companies serving the Medicare Advantage market. Venture capital-backed startups flocking to the health-insurance market have faced a tough learning curve, but investors remain undeterred.

title: Teenager and His Mom Tried to Warn Apple of FaceTime Bug
summary: Michele Thompson said it was frustrating trying to get the attention of one of the world's largest technology companies. An Arizona teenager and his mother spent more than a week trying to warn Apple Inc. of a bug in its FaceTime video-chat software before news of the glitch-which allows one FaceTime user calling another in a group chat to listen in while the recipient's Apple device is still ringing-blew up on social media Monday.

title: Apple's Supporting Cast Can't Carry the Show
summary: Strong sales of iPad, Macs and wearables can't counter weight of iPhone slump. Apple Inc. had a great holiday quarter, save for one product. That still presents a big problem for the high-tech giant.

title: A City-Dweller's Guide to Trekking the Amazon
summary: Determined to catapult himself out of his comfort zone, an urbanite ventures deep into the jungle of the Peruvian Amazon. THE GUY whose task it was to guide me into the Amazon was named Ruber León Sánchez. "Like 'lion,'" he told me after firmly gripping my hand and shaking it as if it needed to be wrung out. The named seemed fitting; the manager at my hotel had the last name of Puma. I wondered if later on I'd meet a woman named Anna Conda. "Let's go," said Ruber, whose confident stride, forest-green fatigues and 2-foot machete swinging from his belt made him king of the jungle in my eyes.

title: Lockheed Martin Offloads $2.6 Billion in Pension Liabilities
summary: Recent market gyrations and drop in rates threaten to hurt earnings of companies with large pension obligations. Lockheed Martin Corp. on Tuesday said it has unloaded $2.6 billion in pension obligations to insurance companies in December, the latest company to deploy a tactic that helps reduce corporate balance sheet exposure to market swings.

title: Gillette, Masculinity and 'Authenticity'
summary: Do millennial consumers really demand that brands embrace their politics?. No word yet on how many men are going without a shave in order to avoid being viewed as toxically masculine Gillette customers. Nor does this column know precisely how many purchasers of razors seek moral guidance from corporate marketing departments. But last week the CEO of Gillette owner Procter & Gamble provided an explanation of the company's decision to produce its much-discussed advertisement targeting "toxic masculinity" and the firm's determination to continue promoting the message. It's an interesting case study in modern marketing.

title: U.S. Dollar Edges Higher Ahead of Fed Meeting
summary: Investors also are looking to Friday's release of payrolls data. The U.S. dollar advanced Tuesday as the Federal Reserve began its first meeting since Chairman Jerome Powell said officials would take a flexible approach to setting rates.

title: Harley-Davidson's Motorcycle Sales Fall Again
summary: Gains abroad aren't offsetting trouble in the motorcycle maker's home market. Harley-Davidson Inc. said sales of its motorcycles fell again last year, raising the stakes for a fleet of new models meant to revive demand in the company's core U.S. market.

title: Cinéma With Too Much Vérité
summary: 'They Shall Not Grow Old' aims to bring World War I to life by colorizing historical film, adding a soundtrack and more, but does Peter Jackson's documentary go too far?.

title: Danny Meyer to Open Cafe at The Shed
summary: Menu remains under development. Add Danny Meyer to the list of culinary stars hoping to make their mark at Hudson Yards.

title: Knight-Swift Profit Jumps on Efficiency Drive at Swift Truckload
summary: The largest North American truckload company cut more than 1,500 trucks from the average tractor count at its biggest operating unit in the fourth quarter compared with the prior year. Knight-Swift Transportation Holdings Inc., the largest truckload company in North America, is overhauling its biggest trucking division to be smaller and more profitable.

title: Acting Defense Chief Predicts End of Islamic State Land Holdings in Two Weeks
summary: Past forecasts of eliminating the extremists' self-proclaimed caliphate were unreliable. Islamic State's grip on territory in Syria could be fully broken within two weeks, acting Defense Secretary Pat Shanahan said Tuesday, the result of U.S.-led efforts to liberate territory held by militants.

title: May Seeks to Renegotiate Brexit Deal With European Union
summary: Prime minister wants to go back to Brussels and renegotiate key parts of agreement. LONDON-British Prime Minister Theresa May said she would seek to reopen Brexit negotiations with the European Union in a high-stakes bid to wring concessions as the clock runs down to the U.K.'s exit from the bloc.

title: Venezuela Steps Up Pressure on U.S.-Backed Opposition Leader
summary: Maduro's government opens investigation into Juan Guaidó for allegedly sabotaging the economy. CARACAS-Venezuela's government ramped up pressure on opposition leader Juan Guaidó on Tuesday amid a deepening political crisis here as Washington took more steps to cut off President Nicolás Maduro's access to funds.

title: Kainos Co-Founder Says Colleagues Illegally Took Her Ownership Stake
summary: Sarah Bradley in a lawsuit also says the Dallas-based buyout firm has a 'frat-house culture'. A co-founder of buyout firm Kainos Capital is suing her colleagues and the firm over an ownership dispute, in a rare public fight for the publicity-averse private-equity industry.

title: The Answer to Manchester United's Alex Ferguson Problem: a Ferguson Clone
summary: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is aiming to emulate his mentor by mimicking his every trait-right down to the tie and jacket. London

title: Public Comments Were Also Sidelined During Shutdown
summary: Deadlines passed for raising issues with 143 proposed federal rules; advocates urge extensions. WASHINGTON-The federal government has one more hangover to deal with from the partial shutdown: what to do about all those deadlines that passed for public comment on proposed regulations.

title: Stocks Pulled Down by Tech Sector
summary: Trade tensions and slowing growth in China have fed into lowered expectations for U.S. corporate profits. The S&P 500 fell for a second consecutive day as shares of some of the big technology companies due to report earnings this week retreated, further endangering a January rally.

title: EBay to Pay Its First-Ever Dividend
summary: Pressured by hedge-fund investors, the company is also boosting its share buybacks. EBay Inc. said Tuesday it would pay a 14-cent dividend in March, its first ever, as the company faces pressure from hedge-fund investors to improve shareholder returns.

title: Former Israeli Army Chief Launches Challenge to Netanyahu
summary: Benny Gantz has emerged as a leading alternative to the prime minister ahead of April elections. TEL AVIV-A former Israeli military chief has emerged as a leading challenger to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, and is touting his security credentials to launch his political campaign ahead of April elections.

title: Apartment Buyers Who Use Corporate Name for Security Reasons May Get Tax Break
summary: Change suggested by members of law-enforcement community, judges who say they need to buy property under limited liability companies for their safety. New York City is considering a change to its property tax exemptions that would let owners who buy apartments under a corporate name apply for the benefit, if they show they did so for security reasons.

title: Trump Won't Act Alone to Move Fannie, Freddie Out of Government Control
summary: White House to work with Congress to overhaul mortgage-finance giants. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration plans to work with Congress to overhaul mortgage-finance giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac , a White House spokeswoman said Tuesday-playing down the idea the administration will seek to unilaterally release the firms from government control.

title: GameStop Ends Search for a Buyer, Shares Plunge
summary: The videogame retailer's stock fell about 28% after the company ended its strategic review. GameStop Corp. has ended plans to sell itself after being in talks with prospective buyers for several months, leaving the company to mull its future as a stand-alone company.

title: Chinese Customers Power LVMH
summary: 'Our target is first and foremost desirability,' CEO says. PARIS-China's well-heeled shoppers in the fourth quarter splurged on Louis Vuitton, Dior and other luxury brands owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton, defying a Chinese economic slowdown and trade tensions between Washington and Beijing.

title: 'Graciela Iturbide's Mexico' Review: Life and Death South of the Border
summary: When her 6-year-old daughter died in 1970, photographer Graciela Iturbide dove into art, pursuing images steeped in ritual, dignity, and the mysteries of being..

title: Many Democrats Aren't Buying It From Billionaires
summary: As top 2020 candidates target the rich with their rhetoric, idea of a Bloomberg run faces skepticism. MANCHESTER, N.H.-Former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg has devoted millions of dollars of his personal wealth to campaigns to curb gun violence and address climate change. He has often cast his fortune in virtuous terms when it comes to politics, noting the degree of independence it gave him while he served a dozen years as mayor.

title: U.S. Security Threats Increase as China and Russia Align
summary: The two nations are pouring resources into a 'race for technological and military superiority,' annual intelligence report says. WASHINGTON-U.S. intelligence officials warned Tuesday of increased threats to national security from tighter cooperation between China and Russia, while also differing with President Trump in their analysis of North Korea's nuclear intentions and the current danger posed by Islamic State.

title: U.S. Sanctions on Venezuela's Crude Giant Boost Oil
summary: The possibility of lower supply from Venezuela helped prices stabilize following Monday's drop. Venezuela: The U.S. late Monday imposed sanctions on Venezuela's state-owned oil giant, Petróleos de Venezuela SA, in an attempt to empower the country's opposition leader and further undermine the government of President Nicolás Maduro.

title: Europe Opens Channel for Trade With Iran
summary: Nations move to restore business without putting banks in the crosshairs of U.S. sanctions. France, Britain and Germany, defying threats from Washington, are this week executing their plans to set up a special-payments company to secure some trade with Iran and blunt the impact of U.S. sanctions.

title: PG&E Bankruptcy Hits Green Energy Suppliers
summary: Many electricity producers, such as Topaz Solar Farms, rely completely on sales to PG&E. PG&E Corp. quickly took steps after filing for bankruptcy protection Tuesday to renegotiate power deals with green energy projects that rely on the California utility for most or all of their revenues.

title: Abrams to Give Democratic Response to Trump's State of the Union
summary: Abrams narrowly lost the 2018 Georgia gubernatorial race and would have been the first African-American woman elected governor. WASHINGTON-Stacey Abrams will give the Democratic response to President Trump's State of the Union address on Feb. 5, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer said.

title: LVMH Doesn't Have Apple's China Problem
summary: Demand from Chinese consumers unexpectedly strengthened in LVMH's latest quarter. It seems that luxury handbags aren't like iPhones or cars. LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton has upset prevailing wisdom about the health of China's shoppers with its latest results.

title: Alleged Pittsburgh Synagogue Shooter Faces More Charges
summary: Robert Bowers faces 63 charges, including hate crimes, for the October shooting that left 11 dead. A federal grand jury charged the man accused of fatally shooting 11 people at a Pittsburgh synagogue last fall with more than a dozen additional offenses, federal prosecutors announced Tuesday.

title: Saudis Not Rushing to Respond to Venezuela Oil Ban
summary: Kingdom aims to avoid the global glut that followed the U.S. administration's request for more oil supply after Washington imposed sanctions on Iran. The last time the U.S. slapped sanctions on a major oil-producing nation, Saudi Arabia backed a coordinated American effort to boost exports and keep global crude supplies in balance.

title: Canada Gets Formal U.S. Extradition Request for Huawei CFO
summary: The request came after U.S. authorities unveiled criminal charges against Meng Wanzhou and the company. Both have denied wrongdoing.. OTTAWA-Canada said Tuesday it received a formal request from the U.S. for the extradition of Huawei Technologies Co.'s chief financial officer, Meng Wanzhou.

title: Marijuana Health Benefits Need More Study
summary: We need more clinical evidence about the possible medical uses of pot.. Peter Bach states: "Marijuana belongs in the same category as alcohol and tobacco-harmful products that adults can choose to enjoy" ("If Weed Is Medicine, So Is Budweiser," op-ed, Jan. 18). This is absolutely correct: Like alcohol, tobacco and hundreds of prescription medications, marijuana has mood-altering effects that many people find pleasurable. Moreover, like all active drugs, marijuana can be harmful if used incorrectly. But the very fact that marijuana clearly has such well-recognized effects that many people use to find relief from some of the same conditions for which they take prescription drugs suggests that it may also have legitimate medical uses. This is something Dr. Bach appears to reject out of hand.

title: Real Costs of NLRB's Franchise Power Grab
summary: A regulation aimed primarily at reducing a nonexistent rise in alternative work arrangements was nothing more than an unnecessary brake on the American economy.. Regarding your "The Real Cure for Economic Insecurity" (Review & Outlook," Jan. 17): It comes as no surprise to small-business franchise owners like me that ivory-tower occupants are now walking back their findings on the "fissured workplace" theory. The only surprise is that it has taken this long to debunk a position taken against small businesses by academia's elite.

title: Let's End Government Shutdowns for Good
summary: If my End Government Shutdowns Act were the law of the land today, we wouldn't have had this mess.. Regarding William A. Galston's "A Bipartisan Shutdown Solution" (Politics & Ideas, Jan. 23): Almost everyone says government shutdowns are a bad idea, so let's end them for good. If my End Government Shutdowns Act were the law of the land today, we wouldn't have had this mess.

title: IPS Worldwide Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Protection
summary: Stanley Black & Decker tops list of unsecured creditors. IPS Worldwide LLC, a freight-payment company, has sought bankruptcy protection to keep creditors - increasingly "antsy" about the company's unpaid debt - at bay, according to a bankruptcy lawyer.

title: Nathan Glazer, a Liberal And Mild Conservative, Too
summary: Glazer's intellectual greatness was his loyalty to the courage of reason.. Nathan Glazer calling himself a "mild conservative" ("Nathan Glazer and Conservatism," Review & Outlook, Jan. 22) was just right. Recently I asked him, looking back, if he was a conservative. He said, "I prefer to call myself a liberal, with all its ambiguity, in view of what neoconservative has come to mean, an overly vigorous and militarized foreign policy." As often, Nat changed gears, "Of course it's easy to make the judgment after the fact." Glazer's intellectual greatness was his loyalty to the courage of reason.

title: U.S. Government Bond Prices Climb on Weaker Economic Data
summary: Investors await Fed's signals about path of interest rates, changes in central bank's bond portfolio. U.S. government bond prices climbed Tuesday as traders reacted to weaker-than-expected economic data and declines in technology stocks.

title: Verizon's Profit Stung by Oath Restructuring
summary: Wireless carrier adds phone connections, books charge for media unit. title: Chinese Exiting U.S. Real Estate as Beijing Directs Money Back to Shore Up Economy
summary: Third-straight quarter Chinese investors sold more commercial U.S. property than they bought.

title: Pfizer Results Hurt by Pricing Challenges

title: Illegal Migrant Crossings Surge in Remote New Mexico Desert
summary: More smugglers are taking Central Americans to tiny Antelope Wells as the U.S. focuses on busy border crossings in California and Texas. ANTELOPE WELLS, N.M.- Breaking several hours of radio silence on a cold January night in this remote desert outpost, a Border Patrol agent called out: "There's a large group about a mile and a half south of the border and heading up."

title: Stone Pleads Not Guilty to Charges in Mueller Indictment
summary: Special counsel charged Trump ally with lying to Congress, witness tampering. summary: Utility seeks chapter 11 protection. PG&E Corp. filed for bankruptcy protection on Tuesday as it struggles with billions of dollars in potential liabilities from its role in sparking California wildfires, triggering one of the largest corporate-reorganization cases in years.

title: If Goat Emojis Are Flooding Your Twitter Feed, Blame Tom Brady
summary: Resume Subscription. It's not hard to imagine how the New England Patriots might celebrate if they win yet another Super Bowl on Sunday. The players will swim in confetti. The surly Patriots coach Bill Belichick will entertain the possibility of smiling. And hundreds of thousands of fans will tweet emojis of a farm animal.

summary: The maker of Post-it Notes and industrial adhesives also expects higher costs to be offset by higher prices. 3M Co. lowered its profit outlook for this year, the latest manufacturer to flag slack demand in China for its products.

summary: Financing designed to fund prolonged stay in chapter 11. PG&E Corp. arrived in chapter 11 bankruptcy at six minutes after midnight on Tuesday, saying it has an immediate need to borrow $1.5 billion as it launches what it says will be a long turnaround effort.

summary: Military contractors report record backlogs as Pentagon revamps older equipment to face challenges from China and Russia. U.S. defense executives expect the Pentagon to boost spending further, potentially ending months of uncertainty about the government's plans that has spooked investors.

title: Germany Escapes the Tyranny of Speed Limits
summary: The German government has slammed the brakes on proposals to introduce a speed limit on freeways. Germany's equivalent of the right to bear arms is the right to drive fast.

title: Court Clears Way for Woman in Blasphemy Case to Leave Pakistan
summary: Extremists vowed to kill Christian farmworker who faced death sentence before conviction was overturned. ISLAMABAD-Pakistan's highest court affirmed its decision to free a Christian woman who had been convicted of blasphemy, dismissing a legal challenge by religious hard-liners.

summary: With U.S. tariff threat looming, China appears poised to let in more U.S. imports but not to make structural changes. WASHINGTON-Cabinet-level delegations from the U.S. and China will resume trade negotiations here Wednesday, but early indications are that the two sides remain sharply divided, suggesting a hard slog ahead for a deal to be cut before a March 1 deadline.

title: U.S. Consumer Confidence Declines
summary: The Conference Board's index fell to 120.2 from 126.6 in December as economic uncertainty weighs on households. WASHINGTON-Consumer confidence dropped in January for a third consecutive month, likely hit by political discord in Washington, in addition to market and economic uncertainty weighing on U.S. households.

summary: Hired brokers fight fines on behalf of service and delivery companies in battle for curb space. Last week, Taylor Reid arrived at the city's parking adjudications office in lower Manhattan pulling a big, black suitcase on wheels.

summary: Report marks the first regulatory action against the company related to the scandal. title: Tennis Star Andy Murray Undergoes Hip Resurfacing Surgery
summary: The procedure may render premature the British star's retirement announcement before the Australian Open. Less than three weeks after announcing his upcoming retirement at the Australian Open, Andy Murray has made a bold move that could extend his professional tennis career after all.

title: Does the Convenience of a Countertop Dishwasher Outweigh the Hassle?
summary: Handwashing dishes is everyone's least favorite chore, but this innovative new kitchen appliance might be as much a nuisance as it is a novelty. FACT: LITERALLY everyone hates doing dishes. A 2018 Council of Contemporary Families report found the disgusting duty to be the least popular of all household chores, affecting even the sex lives of couples who don't equitably share the task. Unfortunately not all households have great big dishwashers to hide grotty plates during the day and run loads at night. In cities like New York and San Francisco, slim, built-in dishwashers have become a coveted feature for anxious apartment hunters.

title: What Could Go Wrong With the Fed on Hold
summary: Investors face three scenarios if the Federal Reserve is done raising rates, none of them obviously good. Here is the conundrum: If markets are right in concluding that the Federal Reserve is on hold, then one of three things has to be true, none of them obviously good for investors. If the market is wrong about the Fed, then tighter policy is coming and January's rally was built on a false foundation.

title: San Francisco Penthouse Seeks a Record $41 Million

title: Even With Four Super Bowl Rings, Terry Bradshaw Doesn't Like to Brag
summary: Before he was a star Steelers quarterback, the athlete practiced throwing and punting a football into trees and snowbanks.. He was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1989 and is co-host of "Fox NFL Sunday." He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Sri Lanka Turns to China for Loans
summary: With bills falling due as island nation's economy falters, government sees Beijing's rates as attractive. Sri Lanka's recent political turbulence has forced it to borrow more from China as it scrambles to raise enough foreign currency to meet its first-quarter debt payments.

title: Myanmar Moves to Pursue Curbs on Military's Role

YANGON, Myanmar-Lawmakers took a first step Tuesday toward amending Myanmar's constitution to curb the power of the military, a difficult process that risks straining the uneasy relations between the civilian leadership and the armed forces.

title: U.S.-China Talks Won't Be Affected by Huawei Charges, Says Mnuchin

summary: Two indictments, 23 criminal charges allege sanctions violations, theft of intellectual property; Huawei denies wrongdoing. As Huawei Technologies Co. sought to boost its smartphone business in 2012, the Chinese manufacturer had a problem: Its phones were failing quality checks by a robot known as Tappy at a higher rate than rivals, U.S. prosecutors said.

title: Home-Price Growth Continues to Slow
summary: Las Vegas had the fastest home price growth in the country for the sixth straight month. Home-price growth continued to ease off the accelerator in November, bolstering economists' predictions that price growth could slow to be more in line with increases in incomes and inflation this year.

title: Landlords Relish-or Fear-J.C. Penney Store Closings
summary: Some mall owners seek better-paying tenants, while others consider rent cuts or other incentives. No one knows how many stores the struggling J.C. Penney Co. may shut this year. But landlords aren't waiting around to find out if theirs will be among the closures.

title: Safest Bet for Super Bowl LIII? Atlanta Hotels
summary: Hotels in the Super Bowl host city always jack up room rates; Atlanta hotels just tripled theirs right before Sunday's showdown. A certain winner in this year's Super Bowl will be Atlanta hotel owners.

title: Adam Selman Is So Excited (And He Just Can't Hide It)
summary: New year, new label: the designer and Rihanna "Anti" tour wardrober is rebooting his own label as unisex athleisure-and its leopard-printed, chartreuse-happy spandex is just what Instagram ordered. Designer Adam Selman only launched his label in 2013, but six years later, he was already itching for a top-down refresh. Cue Adam Selman Sport, a unisex athleisure collection that officially replaces his kittenishly glamorous women's line, which hit e-retailers last week with all the spandex gusto of a Jane Fonda video. It was a preemptive move, he says, to stanch what had become monotonous for him: "At the end of the day, if I am bored by the process, my customers would feel that."

title: PG&E Files for Bankruptcy After California Wildfires
summary: California utility's restructuring will involve state and federal regulators, with implications for customers, fire victims, shareholders and wholesale power providers. title: The Grove's Rick Caruso on Opening His First Hotel
summary: The Los Angeles-based developer's newest venture is inspired by the classic SoCal resort that once stood on its site. BEST KNOWN for his lively L.A. retail ventures, such as Palisades Village and The Grove, billionaire developer Rick Caruso has long dreamed of opening a hotel. Growing up in Beverly Hills, he was friends with the family of Hernando Courtright, the proprietor of the Beverly Wilshire hotel, and spent many hours at the storied property. Caruso, now 60, admired the place's homey vibe-the Courtrights actually lived there-and is incorporating that quality into his first hotel: Rosewood Miramar Beach in Montecito, California.

title: Philippine Cathedral Attack Blamed on Husband-and-Wife Suicide Bombers
summary: Duterte says he believes the bombing was the work of extremist group Abu Sayyaf. President Rodrigo Duterte said on Tuesday that husband-and-wife suicide bombers likely carried out the attack against a Roman Catholic cathedral in the southern Philippines that killed 20 people, an escalation of terrorism by supporters of Islamic State who oppose a peace plan for the strife-torn region.

title: How Tom Brady Conquered His Greatest Opponent: Age
summary: At the age of 41, the Patriots quarterback changed his game to throw shorter passes, get rid of the ball faster and avoid getting hit. And it explains his unprecedented longevity and success.. ATLANTA-Tom Brady looked nothing like an NFL quarterback at the league's pre-draft combine in 2000. His legs were the size of toothpicks, and his college resume consisted of being a benchwarmer who struggled to keep the starting job once he finally won it.

title: Elite Colleges Extend Application Deadlines
summary: Schools pump up application volume but rejection rates are still high. The deadline to apply for admission to Oberlin College was Jan. 15. Until it wasn't.

title: Takeda's Dengue Vaccine Works Safely, Company Says
summary: Public-health officials have been looking forward to results from Takeda's dengue vaccine trial. Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. said Tuesday a key trial showed its dengue vaccine protected children against the widespread tropical disease, raising hopes that a new weapon against the mosquito-borne infection without safety concerns could be approaching.

title: Investors Are Rewarding Earnings Season's Winners-and Losers

title: Big Tech's Capital Bills Aren't Always Telling
summary: Data-center spending slowdown may not portend weakness at tech giants. Big Tech's hearty appetite has given other companies indigestion. It may just be a passing condition.

title: German Software Giant SAP's Restructuring Will Affect 4,400 Jobs
summary: Global software provider has been expanding cloud-computing business as growth in its core software division has slowed. WALLDORF, Germany-Business-software maker SAP SE said Tuesday it will restructure at a cost of nearly $1 billion as it continues to shift toward cloud-based computing.

title: Duterte's Brutal Crime War Turns to Children
summary: Rights groups say proposed law could lead to rise in extrajudicial killings of children in the Philippines. Philippine strongman Rodrigo Duterte is widening his crackdown on drugs and crime by lowering the country's legal age of responsibility, a move opponents say risks sweeping children up as criminals in violence that has killed thousands.

title: Geisha Effect: Asian Skin Care Shakes Up U.S. Beauty Market
summary: Upstarts and legacy cosmetics companies are looking at the skin-care category to boost sales. The rise of Asian skin-care products and rituals has fueled a resurgence in what had been an overlooked area of the beauty industry. Now the companies at the forefront of the skin-care turnaround are trying to maintain their following.

title: China's Auto Sector Can't Run on a 'Nothing Burger' Stimulus
summary: Beijing could yet try to do more to prop up the flagging auto sector. Investors in Chinese auto makers hoping for a roadside rescue from Beijing have been left on the shoulder.

title: Cooling Housing Market Prompts Closer Scrutiny of Some Lenders
summary: Ginnie Mae worries about risks from nonbank lenders, whose share of home loans has ballooned since the financial crisis. One of the principal gatekeepers to housing-finance markets is stepping up scrutiny of nonbank mortgage lenders, concerned that some may not have the financial heft needed to overcome stressed conditions.

title: PG&E Bankruptcy to Be Fee Bonanza
summary: An army of lawyers, bankers and financial advisers could be the big winners in PG&E's bankruptcy. PG&E Corp.'s move to file for bankruptcy to deal with massive liabilities from California wildfires will be long and costly-and it may bring little relief from legal troubles stemming from its safety record, according to people getting ready to participate in the case.

title: Plain-Spoken Fed Chairman Sometimes Leaves Markets Confused
summary: Jerome Powell has taken a conversational tone, but his communications haven't always been understood. title: Apple Set to Delve Into Disappointing December Quarter
summary: The iPhone maker will report quarterly results after the market closes Tuesday. Apple Inc. is scheduled to report results for its fiscal first quarter after the market closes Tuesday. Here's what you need to know.

title: Julia Roberts on Lucas Hedges: "I'm Here Tonight Because I Love and Believe in Lucas"
summary: At WSJ. Magazine's first annual Talents & Legends dinner, held at Mr. Chow's in Los Angeles, an all-time legend toasted one of Hollywood's biggest rising talents: together with WSJ. editor-in-chief Kristina O'Neill, Julia Roberts gathered friends and colleagues to honor her 'Ben Is Back' co-star Lucas Hedges, who earned a Golden Globe nomination this year. Go inside the party and see photos of guests Troye Sivan, Laura Harrier, Alisha Boe, Lana Condor and more. On Monday night in Los Angeles entertainment and fashion figures gathered at WSJ. Magazine's first annual Talents & Legends dinner to celebrate a rising star who's known for his unassuming nature: Lucas Hedges, the magazine's February cover star. "Lucas isn't pretentious at all," said singer Troye Sivan, who acted alongside Hedges in last November's Boy Erased. "He has such an open soul, and there's no ego whatsoever. Working with him puts you at ease."

title: Shutdown Compounds Woes for Immigration System
summary: Courts and border agents-already strapped-look to dig out after funding is restored. WASHINGTON-The immigration-court backlog grew by at least 10% during the partial government shutdown, as a funding dispute centered on border security left the nation's overloaded immigration system digging out of an even deeper hole than before the five-week standoff.

title: Apple Bug Enables Eavesdropping on FaceTime Users
summary: The feature linked to the bug has been disabled but it is a setback for a tech company that touts its commitment to privacy. Apple Inc. scrambled to fix a bug in its FaceTime video-chat system that lets callers eavesdrop on users of iPhones, iPads and Macs, an embarrassing setback for a company that has touted its commitment to privacy.

title: U.S. Levels Criminal Charges Against China's Huawei
summary: Authorities unseal a pair of indictments just days before U.S.-China trade talks are set to resume. summary: Asian domestic yields are at best even with hard-currency yields. An unusual reversal in the bond markets has bypassed Asia.

summary: The officers were attempting to serve a search warrant at a home where drug selling was suspected. Two suspects are dead after a shooting on Monday that injured five Houston police officers, including four who were hit by gunfire as they attempted to serve a search warrant at a home where drug selling was suspected, the police chief said.

summary: Dwight Hammond Jr. and son Steven were pardoned for Oregon fire; supporters took over wildlife refuge for over a month in 2016. title: Housekeeper Rescued After Being Trapped in Manhattan Elevator All Weekend
summary: The incident happened in an affluent stretch of the Upper East Side, in a townhouse at 48 E. 65th St.. A 53-year-old housekeeper was rescued from the elevator of a Manhattan townhouse on Monday morning after being trapped inside for three days, New York City officials said.

title: Soy Prices Are in a Trough After China's Sick-Pig Slaughter
summary: The country is culling hogs in hopes of stopping the spread of a virus, which is bad news for U.S. soybean farmers. China's pig population is shrinking, and that's bad news for American soybean farmers.

summary: Trump administration has said two states should pay larger share of costs. New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy and members of the state's congressional delegation called on the Trump administration Monday to help pay to dig a new rail tunnel connecting their state to New York.

summary: Bill de Blasio rolled out a road map to eliminate childhood lead exposure during the next 10 years. Mayor Bill de Blasio on Monday rolled out a road map to eliminate childhood lead exposure during the next 10 years-particularly in private homes.

title: Maduro Is Putin's Man in Caracas
summary: Russia wants to suppress Latin America's energy production.. During the Cold War, Moscow supported the Latin American left because it naively thought communism was the wave of the future. These days, a more cynical Kremlin supports the Latin left because it knows it will fail. The dramatic confrontation taking shape in Venezuela-where dictator Nicolás Maduro clings to power with Russia's help as the West declares opposition leader Juan Guaidó the legitimate president-is the first major crisis of this new era of great-power competition.

The accusations against him raise constitutional questions about federal regulation of academic research. They also implicitly acknowledge that the prank had a serious point.

title: The 5G Promise and the Huawei Threat
summary: Big Brother is coming to your home via cheap Chinese goods.. Federal prosecutors unsealed a pair of indictments Monday, charging the Chinese technology company Huawei with crimes including bank fraud, sanctions violations and theft of trade secrets. Huawei's behavior is finally being recognized for what it is. Beijing is using companies like Huawei and ZTE as an extension of its intelligence network, engaging in criminal behavior to advance not only the bottom line but the interests of the Chinese state. With the 5G future close at hand, this realization can't come a moment too soon.

title: FTC Has Qualcomm's Number
summary: The chip maker demands licensing fees even for smartphones that don't use its technology.. Lawyers will make their closing arguments Tuesday in a case in San Jose, Calif., that could open the way to greater technological innovation and marketplace competition.

title: 'Twilight of the Elites' Review: On the Outskirts of 'Higher France'
summary: Unlike the urban elites, the working poor of la France périphérique have to live with large-scale immigration's immediate consequences.. French intellectuals love little more than predicting revolution and chaos from a boulevard-side table groaning with red wine and fricasseed innards. A reason to take them seriously is their country's history: the clatter of the tumbrel, the hiss of the guillotine blade, the thud of the aristocrat's head into the basket. The French know the difference between real revolution and a weekend punch-up with the riot police.

title: Yum Brands Opens Search for New CFO
summary: Promotion of CFO David Gibbs to president and COO could place him up as a potential successor to CEO Executive Greg Creed. Yum Brands Inc. is looking for a new chief financial officer following the promotion of its current finance chief, David Gibbs, to president and chief operating officer.

title: Socialists of the World, Unite
summary: Sanders and AOC show their support for Venezuela's dictator.. As Venezuelan dictator Nicolás Maduro hunts for allies amid a revolt of his desperate people, he is finding rare support among America's Democratic socialists.

title: Mike Bloomberg vs. Howard Schultz
summary: How dare another billionaire decide to run for President?. The billionaires are battling, and this should be fun. So it has gone the last two days as Howard Schultz, former Starbucks CEO, told CBS's "60 Minutes" on Sunday that he may run for President as an independent in 2020. That drew a lightning bolt from Mount Bloomberg, also known as former New York City Mayor Michael, who declared that an independent can't win and would help President Trump.

title: Neomi Rao Gets Kavanaughed
summary: The left dredges up college writing to defeat a judicial nominee.. Remember Brett Kavanaugh's high-school yearbook? title: U.S. Places Sanctions on Venezuela's Oil Industry
summary: Actions aimed at crippling President Maduro's government and empowering an opposition leader. title: Kraft Heinz's Devour Advertises on Pornhub as Part of Super Bowl Campaign
summary: 'Brand safety' takes a back seat to making the most of a big-game buy. At a time when many marketers obsess about appearing only in uncontroversial "brand-safe" environments, Kraft Heinz Co. title: Whirlpool Posts Drop in Fourth-Quarter Sales

Whirlpool Corp. on Monday reported a decline in fourth-quarter sales, missing Wall Street's expectations, despite price increases in key businesses like U.S. kitchen appliances.

title: Trump Accepts New Date for State of the Union Speech
summary: Speaker Pelosi invites president to address Congress on Feb. 5. WASHINGTON-President Trump accepted House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's invitation to give his State of the Union address to a joint session of Congress on Feb. 5, a week after the date when he was originally scheduled to give the speech.

title: Notable & Quotable: Cup Fee
summary: 'A new mandate that all restaurants must charge customers a fee for using disposable cups.'. Christian Britschgi writing at Reason.com, Jan. 24:
